newsitem.title: USA: Molinari to co-anchor CBS news program - sources.
newsitem.headline: Molinari to co-anchor CBS news program - sources.

text.p: Representative Susan Molinari of New York, one of the Republican Party's most visible politicians, will become a co-anchor on a new CBS Saturday morning news programme, broadcasting sources said on Tuesday.
CBS confirmed the appointment, but said no details would be available until a news conference on Wednesday morning at the network's headquarters in Manhattan.
CNN reported on Tuesday night that Molinari was expected to announce her resignation from Congress on Wednesday and would likely serve as congresswoman until Aug. 1.
The 39-year-old Molinari represents the New York City borough of Staten Island. She was not available for comment.
Molinari was the keynote speaker at the 1996 Republican National Convention in San Diego and is considered one of the party's leading women politicians.
She is married to Representative Bill Paxon, also a New York Republican. Her father, Guy Molinari, preceded her in Congress and is active in New York's Republican Party.

The two-hour CBS Saturday morning news programme, to be called "CBS News Saturday Morning," is scheduled to begin airing in September, a CBS spokeswoman said. The co-anchor who will work with Molinari has not been announced.
